intro: Lycianthes lasiophylla, commonly known as the roughleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, peppers, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for agricultural purposes.
